Key Match Events: Jeremy Sarmiento scored for Ecuador with a low shot.
Jhonder Cadiz scored for Venezuela from Salomon Rondon's layoff.
Eduard Bello scored the winning goal for Venezuela.
Pre-Game Insights: Enner Valencia was sent off for an incredibly ugly lunge on Venezuela defender Jose Martinez.
Ecuador played the majority of the match with 10 players after their captain, Enner Valencia, was sent off.
Venezuela's win is just the third time they have begun the tournament with a victory in 20 years.
Venezuela have won just eight of their 70 Copa America matches all-time.
Ecuador hasn't won their opening match at Copa America since 1993.
Post-Match Reflections: Venezuela's win gives them a fantastic platform from which to attempt to reach the knockout stages.
With Enner Valencia likely to be suspended for their remaining two group-stage games, Ecuador may struggle to finish in the top two of Group B.
Jefferson Savarino replaced Yeferson Soteldo and Eric Ram√≠rez for Venezuela, bringing them closer to the end of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in California.
The referee added five minutes of stoppage time at the end of the second half.
